Title: Software Product Manager
Description: Why Packsize?Ever wonder why the products you order arrive in an oversized box filled with air pillows? Packsize ensures that every product can ship in the smallest box possible. Our custom packaging solutions save time, money, and the environment.We face interesting challenges every day. We believe our customers have better things to worry about than finding a box for their products. We believe every company can use technology to cut costs, increase productivity, eliminate wasteful practices, and develop a more sustainable packaging supply chain.What Engineering DoesWe work in a Lean Software development environment as cross-functional teams. Together we develop new products, services, and features of the Packsize platform for our on-demand box making machines, integration with other systems, optimizing complex workflows, and more. We are highly collaborative with Product Managers, UX, senior management, stakeholders, and our customers. We are continuously looking at the health of our engineering culture and how we can learn and improve. We also investigate new technologies and how we will leverage them to solve problems in new and better ways including IoT, cloud, and stream analytics.The ChallengeWe work in the unique space where software meets hardware. Preferred experience in managing and navigating the complexity of hardware, plc software, and application software will be an asset as we continue to make on-demand, right-sized packaging a reality for our customers.Our core software team is located at our headquarters in Salt Lake City, Utah. You will work with a cross-functional team of engineers and UX designers to identify what we build into our products. You will collect and synthesize data points to identify the problem to solve that will deliver the most value.Product Managers are critical to the success of our teams working to implement software product features into our current fleet of machines, as well as vital in the definition of software requirements for upcoming hardware platforms. Your excellent written and verbal communication skills will be critical in gaining alignment on your team and across stakeholders.We focus on Lean Software development so you should feel comfortable navigating and organizing work items with kanban tools, analyzing and improving the overall process, identifying and communicating customer value, and continuous learning and improvement should be part of your daily life.As the Product Manager, it is your responsibility to understand our domain and empathize with our customers. You will have the opportunity to demonstrate your passion for product discovery by designing and conducting user research. You will work with UX designers on a daily basis as you research, test assumptions, and drive product strategy. Working with our software engineers on a daily basis is something you are comfortable with and seeking their expertise is key to establishing the feasibility of solutions and planning the pace of delivery. Your leadership sets the tone in determining what gets developed and what does not.Key Responsibilities*Learn the complex domain of On-Demand Packaging and how it can be leveraged to streamline our customers’ shipping processes. Develop a deep understanding of - and empathy for - our customers.*A focus on outcome-driven activities over a process. i.e., “What impact do we want to achieve?”*Utilize lean software development and optimize for value delivery. Your involvement in all aspects of the product delivery are key to its success, from discovery to development, delivery and beyond.*Understand and manage cross-group collaboration, dependencies, and risks to deliver on schedule and with world-class quality. The ability to drive collaboration across teams is essential to success. You play a critical role in creating alignment across the organization.*Facilitate and guide groups of people towards a decision and when difficult decisions must be made, you are comfortable leveraging data to choose a course of action.*You are an excellent communicator. You provide honest and candid feedback while also seeking feedback from others.*You ask specific questions, understand subtle differences, and challenge what has previously been done.*You define success and success metrics but are not afraid of missteps. You leverage small experiments to inform changes in strategy and approaches to accomplishing the vision.*You reflect the strategic priorities of Packsize.
